<item><title>PM Modi fires GST barb at retiring RS members</title><description>New Delhi, May 13 (ANI): Conveying his best wishes to the retiring members of the Rajya Sabha, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday wished the GST Bill to have been passed in their presence. "I wish all the members retiring from the Rajya Sabha. After leaving the Rajya Sabha, I assure you that this government would continue to serve in the same way as it has been doing during your tenure as the members," Prime Minister Modi said in the Upper House.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/pm-modi-fires-gst-barb-retiring-rs-members-071015557.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:40:15 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">pm-modi-fires-gst-barb-retiring-rs-members-071015557</guid></item><item><title>Insight - Modi reforms flicker in rural India, other big challenges remain</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/insight-modi-reforms-flicker-rural-india-other-big-070803774.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/E7vo27E7NAyRfx6MfggkjQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T001617Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C00A_RTROPTP_2_INDIA-MODI.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="File photo of Indian Prime Minister Modi arriving to address the nation from the historic Red Fort during Independence Day celebrations in Delhi" align="left" title="File photo of Indian Prime Minister Modi arriving to address the nation from the historic Red Fort during Independence Day celebrations in Delhi" border="0" /></a>By Tommy Wilkes and Rupam Jain RAMPARA KISANA, India (Reuters) - For Indian farmer Sompal Singh, the light bulb that flickers outside his mud hut home is a symbol of progress: the first time electricity from the grid has reached his remote village since independence in 1947. It is also a big deal for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who has promised to provide electricity to every village before the end of 2018 and is trying to woo the huge rural population ahead of a key election in Uttar Pradesh state next year. &quot;The (electricity) supply is erratic but we are happy that there has been a start,&quot; said Singh, a 37-year-old father of three, who employs a bullock to work the fields in Rampara Kisana, six hours&#039; drive east of New Delhi.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/insight-modi-reforms-flicker-rural-india-other-big-070803774.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:38:03 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">insight-modi-reforms-flicker-rural-india-other-big-070803774</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/E7vo27E7NAyRfx6MfggkjQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T001617Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C00A_RTROPTP_2_INDIA-MODI.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/insight-modi-reforms-flicker-rural-india-other-big-070803774.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/E7vo27E7NAyRfx6MfggkjQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T001617Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C00A_RTROPTP_2_INDIA-MODI.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="File photo of Indian Prime Minister Modi arriving to address the nation from the historic Red Fort during Independence Day celebrations in Delhi" align="left" title="File photo of Indian Prime Minister Modi arriving to address the nation from the historic Red Fort during Independence Day celebrations in Delhi" border="0" /></a>By Tommy Wilkes and Rupam Jain RAMPARA KISANA, India (Reuters) - For Indian farmer Sompal Singh, the light bulb that flickers outside his mud hut home is a symbol of progress: the first time electricity from the grid has reached his remote village since independence in 1947. It is also a big deal for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who has promised to provide electricity to every village before the end of 2018 and is trying to woo the huge rural population ahead of a key election in Uttar Pradesh state next year. &quot;The (electricity) supply is erratic but we are happy that there has been a start,&quot; said Singh, a 37-year-old father of three, who employs a bullock to work the fields in Rampara Kisana, six hours&#039; drive east of New Delhi.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Cong to knock EC's door over PM Modi's Kerala-Somalia comparison</title><description>New Delhi, May 13 (ANI): The Congress will on Friday lead a delegation to the Election Commission to lodge a formal complaint against Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his comment comparing Kerala with Somalia. Speaking to ANI, Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi said he will be part of the delegation, which includes Ahmed Patel, Motilal Vohra and possibly Digvijaya Singh. The delegation will go to the Election Commission with a written complaint against the Prime Minister.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/cong-knock-ecs-door-over-pm-modis-kerala-070142117.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:31:42 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">cong-knock-ecs-door-over-pm-modis-kerala-070142117</guid></item><item><title>SC upholds criminal defamation law</title><description>New Delhi, May 13 (ANI): The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed the petitions by BJP leader Subramanian Swamy, Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal challenging the constitutional validity of Sections 499 and 500 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) providing for criminal defamation.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/sc-upholds-criminal-defamation-law-060611545.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 11:36:11 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">sc-upholds-criminal-defamation-law-060611545</guid></item><item><title>Unfazed by privilege motion Swamy dares Congress, says would teach them law</title><description>New Delhi, May 13 (ANI): Unperturbed by a privilege motion being moved against him, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP Subramanian Swamy on Friday dared the Congress to do their worst and that he will teach them the real meaning of law. Talking to ANI over Congress moving a privilege motion claiming that documents authenticated by Swamy on the AgustaWestland chopper deal were "bogus", Swamy said that the grand-old party has lost it completely.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/unfazed-privilege-motion-swamy-dares-congress-says-teach-054924302.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 11:19:24 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">unfazed-privilege-motion-swamy-dares-congress-says-teach-054924302</guid></item><item><title>Football: FIFA congress seeks to clean up mess</title><description>FIFA's new president Gianni Infantino will preside over world football's annual congress in Mexico City on Friday to push through reforms aimed at rehabilitating the scandal-tarred organization. Infantino -- who was elected in February after his predecessor Sepp Blatter was brought down by the corruption crisis -- wants to turn the page and put the focus back on football. "We will show to the world we are serious with the reforms, with our democratic process and football development," Infantino said Thursday at an opening ceremony for the congress.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/football-fifa-congress-seeks-clean-053534071.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 11:05:34 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">football-fifa-congress-seeks-clean-053534071</guid></item><item><title>How did Rocky get gun license without verification: Tejasvi Yadav asks Centre</title><description>Patna, May 13 (ANI): With the Bihar government under fire over the tragic incident of a teenager's murder allegedly by Janata Dal (United) MLC Manorama Devi's son Rocky Yadav in a road rage incident, state Deputy Chief Minister Tejaswi Yadav on Friday shifted the blame on the Centre asserting that the accused had procured a gun license without verification, clearly through the influence of someone powerful within the government. It has been printed today in a Delhi newspaper that the Delhi Police gave the gun license without verification.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/did-rocky-gun-license-without-verification-tejasvi-yadav-053436062.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 11:04:36 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">did-rocky-gun-license-without-verification-tejasvi-yadav-053436062</guid></item><item><title>Pramod Tiwari gives notice in RS over Swamy's remark on Rajan</title><description>New Delhi, May 13 (ANI): Congress leader Pramod Tiwari on Friday gave a notice in the Rajya Sabha for a discussion in zero hour over Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Subramanian Swamy's remark on RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan. "I have given a notice in the Rajya Sabha for discussion in zero hour over Swamy's remark on RBI Governor.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/pramod-tiwari-gives-notice-rs-over-swamys-remark-053436299.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 11:04:36 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">pramod-tiwari-gives-notice-rs-over-swamys-remark-053436299</guid></item><item><title>Delhi civic bypolls: Parties bring in star campaigners, target each other</title><description>All three major political parties in Delhi have something at stake in the forthcoming bypolls in 13 wards of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). The BJP is seeking to consolidate its hold on the municipal corporation in the final year of its 10-year rule, the Congress is hoping to make a comeback and AAP is confident of making inroads into what has been a BJP stronghold until now. The bypolls will be held in seven wards of the South Delhi Municipal Corporation, four of the North Delhi Muncipal Corporation and two of the East Delhi Muncipal Corporation on May 15.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/delhi-civic-bypolls-parties-bring-051300285.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:43:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">delhi-civic-bypolls-parties-bring-051300285</guid></item><item><title>Offered bananas before photo: ‘Boy in Somalia jibe picture’</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/offered-bananas-photo-boy-somalia-045200962.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Isxlths_yXwL62NtUoPIxA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/8282ec2b400135110e0bdcd8db5a0c97" width="130" height="86" alt="Offered bananas before photo: ‘Boy in Somalia jibe picture’" align="left" title="Offered bananas before photo: ‘Boy in Somalia jibe picture’" border="0" /></a>ONE OF the children in the photograph that Prime Minister Narendra Modi referred to while suggesting that the situation of Scheduled Tribe (ST) children in Kerala “was more khatarnaak (dangerous) than in Somalia”, reportedly revealed in a video that women working at the garbage yard had offered them bananas before the picture was taken. The video has been released by the Kerala chief minister’s office (CMO) under the title: ‘The true story behind the incident of tribal children reportedly eating stale food from a waste dumping area’. In it, the boy, who allegedly features in the photograph, is heard alleging that chechis (Malayalam for older women) had first asked them (three children) to collect waste in a bag before returning with the bananas.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/offered-bananas-photo-boy-somalia-045200962.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:22:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">offered-bananas-photo-boy-somalia-045200962</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Isxlths_yXwL62NtUoPIxA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/8282ec2b400135110e0bdcd8db5a0c97" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/offered-bananas-photo-boy-somalia-045200962.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Isxlths_yXwL62NtUoPIxA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/8282ec2b400135110e0bdcd8db5a0c97" width="130" height="86" alt="Offered bananas before photo: ‘Boy in Somalia jibe picture’" align="left" title="Offered bananas before photo: ‘Boy in Somalia jibe picture’" border="0" /></a>ONE OF the children in the photograph that Prime Minister Narendra Modi referred to while suggesting that the situation of Scheduled Tribe (ST) children in Kerala “was more khatarnaak (dangerous) than in Somalia”, reportedly revealed in a video that women working at the garbage yard had offered them bananas before the picture was taken. The video has been released by the Kerala chief minister’s office (CMO) under the title: ‘The true story behind the incident of tribal children reportedly eating stale food from a waste dumping area’. In it, the boy, who allegedly features in the photograph, is heard alleging that chechis (Malayalam for older women) had first asked them (three children) to collect waste in a bag before returning with the bananas.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Chandigarh closing of two parking lots: Congress supports traders</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandigarh-closing-two-parking-lots-045000266.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/D9TMiy7vLpR6IDxa3riPxA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/7c446144580c525bc11b31109250fc7b" width="130" height="86" alt="Chandigarh closing of two parking lots: Congress supports traders" align="left" title="Chandigarh closing of two parking lots: Congress supports traders" border="0" /></a>In support of the traders, the Congress on Thursday said five of their party leaders will sit on hunger strike daily until the decision of closing the two parking lots is rolled back. City Congress chief Pardeep Chhabra produced the initial proposal of the Sector 17 multi-level parking, wherein he showed that there was no plan of closing the existing two parking lots. Commenting on Sood’s statement that the issue (part of smart city agenda) was passed in the municipal house meet in March, Chhabra said the plan was to develop Sector 17 and not closing the parking lots.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandigarh-closing-two-parking-lots-045000266.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:20:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">chandigarh-closing-two-parking-lots-045000266</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/D9TMiy7vLpR6IDxa3riPxA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/7c446144580c525bc11b31109250fc7b" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandigarh-closing-two-parking-lots-045000266.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/D9TMiy7vLpR6IDxa3riPxA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/7c446144580c525bc11b31109250fc7b" width="130" height="86" alt="Chandigarh closing of two parking lots: Congress supports traders" align="left" title="Chandigarh closing of two parking lots: Congress supports traders" border="0" /></a>In support of the traders, the Congress on Thursday said five of their party leaders will sit on hunger strike daily until the decision of closing the two parking lots is rolled back. City Congress chief Pardeep Chhabra produced the initial proposal of the Sector 17 multi-level parking, wherein he showed that there was no plan of closing the existing two parking lots. Commenting on Sood’s statement that the issue (part of smart city agenda) was passed in the municipal house meet in March, Chhabra said the plan was to develop Sector 17 and not closing the parking lots.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Chandigarh: Traders observe blackout in protest of closing two Sec 17 parking lots</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandigarh-traders-observe-blackout-protest-044400723.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Kb3wZhvRkYGFMs5SzhhNFg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/9c6748593f911c520cde14879409a414" width="130" height="86" alt="Chandigarh: Traders observe blackout in protest of closing two Sec 17 parking lots" align="left" title="Chandigarh: Traders observe blackout in protest of closing two Sec 17 parking lots" border="0" /></a>Traders of Sector 17 observed a blackout by turning off the lights of their shops for two hours on Wednesday evening to protest against the decision of closing the two existing parking lots in the sector. During a meeting with mayor Arun Sood and commissioner Baldeo Purushartha, the traders suggested that either the two parking lots be closed only till 11.30am or one more multi-level parking lot is constructed. The traders were accompanied by BJP leader Harmohan Dhawan when they went to meet the municipal commissioner.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandigarh-traders-observe-blackout-protest-044400723.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:14:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">chandigarh-traders-observe-blackout-protest-044400723</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Kb3wZhvRkYGFMs5SzhhNFg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/9c6748593f911c520cde14879409a414" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandigarh-traders-observe-blackout-protest-044400723.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Kb3wZhvRkYGFMs5SzhhNFg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/9c6748593f911c520cde14879409a414" width="130" height="86" alt="Chandigarh: Traders observe blackout in protest of closing two Sec 17 parking lots" align="left" title="Chandigarh: Traders observe blackout in protest of closing two Sec 17 parking lots" border="0" /></a>Traders of Sector 17 observed a blackout by turning off the lights of their shops for two hours on Wednesday evening to protest against the decision of closing the two existing parking lots in the sector. During a meeting with mayor Arun Sood and commissioner Baldeo Purushartha, the traders suggested that either the two parking lots be closed only till 11.30am or one more multi-level parking lot is constructed. The traders were accompanied by BJP leader Harmohan Dhawan when they went to meet the municipal commissioner.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Closing of two parking lots: House passed agenda as part of smart city presentation, says Chandigarh Mayor</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/closing-two-parking-lots-house-043800476.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/vLFSt54F7jCp5Ikr4ARl1A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/908763efbe9d86a16a831c5288e9de88" width="130" height="86" alt="Closing of two parking lots: House passed agenda as part of smart city presentation, says Chandigarh Mayor" align="left" title="Closing of two parking lots: House passed agenda as part of smart city presentation, says Chandigarh Mayor" border="0" /></a>Mayor Arun Sood on Thursday said the decision to close the two parking lots in Sector 17 was taken by the House that had unanimously passed this agenda as a part of the smart city presentation. Referring to the agenda, Sood said he was not to be blamed if the councillors did not hear properly during the house meet what the development of Sector 17 plaza was all about. The smart city presentation clearly mentioned the development plans for the Sector 17 plaza, which would be maintained for walkers and cyclists.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/closing-two-parking-lots-house-043800476.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 10:08:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">closing-two-parking-lots-house-043800476</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/vLFSt54F7jCp5Ikr4ARl1A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/908763efbe9d86a16a831c5288e9de88" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/closing-two-parking-lots-house-043800476.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/vLFSt54F7jCp5Ikr4ARl1A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/908763efbe9d86a16a831c5288e9de88" width="130" height="86" alt="Closing of two parking lots: House passed agenda as part of smart city presentation, says Chandigarh Mayor" align="left" title="Closing of two parking lots: House passed agenda as part of smart city presentation, says Chandigarh Mayor" border="0" /></a>Mayor Arun Sood on Thursday said the decision to close the two parking lots in Sector 17 was taken by the House that had unanimously passed this agenda as a part of the smart city presentation. Referring to the agenda, Sood said he was not to be blamed if the councillors did not hear properly during the house meet what the development of Sector 17 plaza was all about. The smart city presentation clearly mentioned the development plans for the Sector 17 plaza, which would be maintained for walkers and cyclists.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>ITI student murder: TMC leader Tapas Mallick arrested</title><description>Kolkata, May 11 (ANI): Local Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Tapas Mallick was arrested today from Bamangachhi, North 24 Parganas in West Bengal in the case of the murder of ITI student Kaushik Purkait, who was lynched to death by a mob three days ago on the suspicion of being a cattle smuggler.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/iti-student-murder-tmc-leader-tapas-mallick-arrested-042408000.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:54:08 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">iti-student-murder-tmc-leader-tapas-mallick-arrested-042408000</guid></item><item><title>After ‘meet’ with Prashant Kishor, Bir undecided on support to Jagmeet Singh Brar</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/meet-prashant-kishor-bir-undecided-041500790.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/mDVifZS8ki3fnG_7EU4gng--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/bec4e519866a39facf6544b70fb346ba" width="130" height="86" alt="After ‘meet’ with Prashant Kishor, Bir undecided on support to Jagmeet Singh Brar" align="left" title="After ‘meet’ with Prashant Kishor, Bir undecided on support to Jagmeet Singh Brar" border="0" /></a>THE PLAN of two Congress rebels - ex-MP Jagmeet Singh Brar and former deputy speaker Bir Devinder Singh - to join forces at the former’s rally slated for May 21 seems to have been scuttled by strategist Prashant Kishor, who reportedly had ‘secret’ meetings with both leaders here recently. The long meetings, kept under wraps, reportedly took place at CLP leader Charanjit Singh Channi’s official residence in Sector 2 and it is learnt that Bir Devinder was made to understand that he still had a future in the Congress. Congress, it appears, went into a tizzy when Jagmeet called on Bir Devinder at the latter’s Patiala residence on May 3.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/meet-prashant-kishor-bir-undecided-041500790.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:45:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">meet-prashant-kishor-bir-undecided-041500790</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/mDVifZS8ki3fnG_7EU4gng--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/bec4e519866a39facf6544b70fb346ba" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/meet-prashant-kishor-bir-undecided-041500790.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/mDVifZS8ki3fnG_7EU4gng--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/bec4e519866a39facf6544b70fb346ba" width="130" height="86" alt="After ‘meet’ with Prashant Kishor, Bir undecided on support to Jagmeet Singh Brar" align="left" title="After ‘meet’ with Prashant Kishor, Bir undecided on support to Jagmeet Singh Brar" border="0" /></a>THE PLAN of two Congress rebels - ex-MP Jagmeet Singh Brar and former deputy speaker Bir Devinder Singh - to join forces at the former’s rally slated for May 21 seems to have been scuttled by strategist Prashant Kishor, who reportedly had ‘secret’ meetings with both leaders here recently. The long meetings, kept under wraps, reportedly took place at CLP leader Charanjit Singh Channi’s official residence in Sector 2 and it is learnt that Bir Devinder was made to understand that he still had a future in the Congress. Congress, it appears, went into a tizzy when Jagmeet called on Bir Devinder at the latter’s Patiala residence on May 3.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Punjab and Haryana HC orders SIT to probe bribery charges against ex-CPS Fauji</title><description>The Punjab and Haryana High Court on Thursday directed the Haryana DGP to constitute a special investigation team (SIT) comprising three Haryana cadre IPS officers, preferably natives of other states, to probe allegations against former Haryana Congress MLA Ram Kishan Fauji of seeking Rs 5 crore bribe to get change of land use (CLU) permission in Gurgaon.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/punjab-haryana-hc-orders-sit-035500784.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:25:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">punjab-haryana-hc-orders-sit-035500784</guid></item><item><title>TN polls: Parties intensify wooing electorate as campaigning ends tomorrow</title><description>Chennai, May 13 (ANI): With campaigning for the Tamil Nadu Assembly Election drawing to a close tomorrow evening, parties have intensified their election tour in the state. Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh in a BJP rally at Mylapore last night, said that the freebie culture of the Dravidian parties cannot be a long term solution to the livelihood issues of the public. Chief Minister J.Jayalalithaa concluded her election tour yesterday at Tirunelveli and said she has fulfilled all her promises made in the party's 2011 election manifesto.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/tn-polls-parties-intensify-wooing-electorate-campaigning-ends-034821962.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 09:18:21 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">tn-polls-parties-intensify-wooing-electorate-campaigning-ends-034821962</guid></item><item><title>AgustaWestland deal: Swamy lied, will move privilege motion against him, says Congress</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/agustawestland-chopper-deal-swamy-lied-032800584.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Eet7jzlXZ4nzqMhlv08ckg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/7721be0cf1976e32e71111302a6ad140" width="130" height="86" alt="AgustaWestland deal: Swamy lied, will move privilege motion against him, says Congress" align="left" title="AgustaWestland deal: Swamy lied, will move privilege motion against him, says Congress" border="0" /></a>The Congress has said it will move a privilege motion against Subramanian Swamy on Friday, claiming that the 13-page document authenticated and tabled by the Rajya Sabha member — from which he quoted during his speech in the House on the AgustaWestland chopper deal — was “bogus”. The Congress also said it would move a privilege motion against Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar for a similar reason. “During the debate on May 4 (in Rajya Sabha), Swamy had levelled many allegations and said many baseless things.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/agustawestland-chopper-deal-swamy-lied-032800584.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:58:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">agustawestland-chopper-deal-swamy-lied-032800584</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Eet7jzlXZ4nzqMhlv08ckg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/7721be0cf1976e32e71111302a6ad140" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/agustawestland-chopper-deal-swamy-lied-032800584.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Eet7jzlXZ4nzqMhlv08ckg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/7721be0cf1976e32e71111302a6ad140" width="130" height="86" alt="AgustaWestland deal: Swamy lied, will move privilege motion against him, says Congress" align="left" title="AgustaWestland deal: Swamy lied, will move privilege motion against him, says Congress" border="0" /></a>The Congress has said it will move a privilege motion against Subramanian Swamy on Friday, claiming that the 13-page document authenticated and tabled by the Rajya Sabha member — from which he quoted during his speech in the House on the AgustaWestland chopper deal — was “bogus”. The Congress also said it would move a privilege motion against Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar for a similar reason. “During the debate on May 4 (in Rajya Sabha), Swamy had levelled many allegations and said many baseless things.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>SC to pronounce verdict on pleas challenging for criminal defamation.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/sc-pronounce-verdict-pleas-challenging-criminal-defamation-today-031715036.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:47:15 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">sc-pronounce-verdict-pleas-challenging-criminal-defamation-today-031715036</guid></item><item><title>Drought src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/FxnZ849pk.wmefilutZaew--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/9f5ed0bc569ccf21a627c34214e3e9e8" Latur District Collector Pandurang Pole said the bill was received about ten days ago. “The bill of Rs 2.16 crore is for the initial fortnight.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/month-water-train-railways-sends-031500547.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:45:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">month-water-train-railways-sends-031500547</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/FxnZ849pk.wmefilutZaew--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/9f5ed0bc569ccf21a627c34214e3e9e8" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/month-water-train-railways-sends-031500547.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/FxnZ849pk.wmefilutZaew--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/9f5ed0bc569ccf21a627c34214e3e9e8" width="130" height="86" alt="Drought crisis: Month after the water train, Railways sends dry Latur a Rs 2-crore bill" align="left" title="Drought crisis: Month after the water train, Railways sends dry Latur a Rs 2-crore bill" border="0" /></a>A Month after it was praised for coming to Latur’s rescue by dispatching a water train, the Railways has sent the drought-hit district a bill of Rs 2.16 crore for the service rendered. Latur District Collector Pandurang Pole said the bill was received about ten days ago. “The bill of Rs 2.16 crore is for the initial fortnight.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Nitish’s selfishness is weakening unity of Grand Alliance: RJD’s Raghuvansh Singh</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/raghuvansh-first-rjd-voice-slam-031400341.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/hCUecHetmsax9jWFSP1NJg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/565e3a5029d023f4a9a3a95ef01e2534" width="130" height="86" alt="Nitish’s selfishness is weakening unity of Grand Alliance: RJD’s Raghuvansh Singh" align="left" title="Nitish’s selfishness is weakening unity of Grand Alliance: RJD’s Raghuvansh Singh" border="0" /></a>In the first direct attack on the Bihar chief minister by partner RJD, former Union Minister and party vice-president Raghuvansh Prasad Singh Thursday said Nitish Kumar’s “selfishness” in “projecting himself as a leader” of a possible anti-BJP front is “weakening secular forces”. Tearing into the chief minister’s “new zeal to enforce prohibition and demand a ban on liquor nationally”, Singh, who is close to RJD chief Lalu Prasad, told reporters in Patna that Nitish “first took liquor to every household in Bihar and is now on an overdrive to enforce a ban on liquor” to fulfil his “political ambition”. “Nitish looks to be an obstacle to the possible unity of secular forces for Mission 2019.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/raghuvansh-first-rjd-voice-slam-031400341.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:44:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">raghuvansh-first-rjd-voice-slam-031400341</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/hCUecHetmsax9jWFSP1NJg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/565e3a5029d023f4a9a3a95ef01e2534" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/raghuvansh-first-rjd-voice-slam-031400341.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/hCUecHetmsax9jWFSP1NJg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/565e3a5029d023f4a9a3a95ef01e2534" width="130" height="86" alt="Nitish’s selfishness is weakening unity of Grand Alliance: RJD’s Raghuvansh Singh" align="left" title="Nitish’s selfishness is weakening unity of Grand Alliance: RJD’s Raghuvansh Singh" border="0" /></a>In the first direct attack on the Bihar chief minister by partner RJD, former Union Minister and party vice-president Raghuvansh Prasad Singh Thursday said Nitish Kumar’s “selfishness” in “projecting himself as a leader” of a possible anti-BJP front is “weakening secular forces”. Tearing into the chief minister’s “new zeal to enforce prohibition and demand a ban on liquor nationally”, Singh, who is close to RJD chief Lalu Prasad, told reporters in Patna that Nitish “first took liquor to every household in Bihar and is now on an overdrive to enforce a ban on liquor” to fulfil his “political ambition”. “Nitish looks to be an obstacle to the possible unity of secular forces for Mission 2019.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>PMLA court likely to pronounce order on Bhujbal's bail plea today</title><description>Mumbai, May 13 (ANI): The special court for Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) is likely to pronounce its verdict on the bail plea filed by Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader and former Maharashtra minister Chhagan Bhujbal who has been arrested in a money laundering case in connection with the alleged Maharashtra Sadan scam. The court had on Wednesday extended the judicial custody of Bhujbal and his nephew Sameer Bhujbal till May 25. Special Judge of the PMLA court, P.R Bhavke heard the arguments of lawyers of Bhujbal and Enforcement Directorate before reserving the order.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/pmla-court-likely-pronounce-order-bhujbals-bail-plea-030937816.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:39:37 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://aniin.com/">ANI</source><guid isPermaLink="false">pmla-court-likely-pronounce-order-bhujbals-bail-plea-030937816</guid></item><item><title>‘Nothing wrong in setting up a Sainik Colony’: BJP leader Nirmal Singh</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/nothing-wrong-setting-sainik-colony-030100148.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/aqcSBJF1TQv8Jsfvc9BVHg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/0ff32eabb42fbd288d09e1e186c8ab87" width="130" height="86" alt="‘Nothing wrong in setting up a Sainik Colony’: BJP leader Nirmal Singh" align="left" title="‘Nothing wrong in setting up a Sainik Colony’: BJP leader Nirmal Singh" border="0" /></a>With the ruling PDP-BJP alliance under fire over reports about plans to set up a Sainik Colony in the Valley, BJP leader and Deputy CM Nirmal Singh Thursday said that such a demand was “neither illegal nor unethical’’. If there can be a Gujjar colony, a teachers’ colony or the demand for having a press colony, why can’t there be a Sainik Colony for serving or retired soldiers and their families who are permanent residents of the state...While there has been no such issue before the state government at the moment, what is wrong in it?...We are not settling outsiders here.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/nothing-wrong-setting-sainik-colony-030100148.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:31:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">nothing-wrong-setting-sainik-colony-030100148</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/aqcSBJF1TQv8Jsfvc9BVHg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/0ff32eabb42fbd288d09e1e186c8ab87" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/nothing-wrong-setting-sainik-colony-030100148.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/aqcSBJF1TQv8Jsfvc9BVHg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/0ff32eabb42fbd288d09e1e186c8ab87" width="130" height="86" alt="‘Nothing wrong in setting up a Sainik Colony’: BJP leader Nirmal Singh" align="left" title="‘Nothing wrong in setting up a Sainik Colony’: BJP leader Nirmal Singh" border="0" /></a>With the ruling PDP-BJP alliance under fire over reports about plans to set up a Sainik Colony in the Valley, BJP leader and Deputy CM Nirmal Singh Thursday said that such a demand was “neither illegal nor unethical’’. If there can be a Gujjar colony, a teachers’ colony or the demand for having a press colony, why can’t there be a Sainik Colony for serving or retired soldiers and their families who are permanent residents of the state...While there has been no such issue before the state government at the moment, what is wrong in it?...We are not settling outsiders here.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>CM Rawat meets Sonia, ducks question on holding early polls</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/cm-rawat-meets-sonia-ducks-025600736.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/IJwWBO4k5ATjCqEL4fFnfQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/2cf8f1c53c13b2bbe116e9ec6eb8bf2a" width="130" height="86" alt="CM Rawat meets Sonia, ducks question on holding early polls" align="left" title="CM Rawat meets Sonia, ducks question on holding early polls" border="0" /></a>A day after being reinstated as the Chief Minister of Uttarakhand, Harish Rawat Thursday arrived in Delhi along with his council of ministers and met Congress president Sonia Gandhi. Rawat also said that as chief minister he was always willing to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Finance Minister Arun Jaitley for the development of the state. Asked about the possibility of a Cabinet reshuffle or snap polls in the state, Rawat said: “That will happen when the time comes.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/cm-rawat-meets-sonia-ducks-025600736.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:26:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">cm-rawat-meets-sonia-ducks-025600736</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/IJwWBO4k5ATjCqEL4fFnfQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/2cf8f1c53c13b2bbe116e9ec6eb8bf2a" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/cm-rawat-meets-sonia-ducks-025600736.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/IJwWBO4k5ATjCqEL4fFnfQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/2cf8f1c53c13b2bbe116e9ec6eb8bf2a" width="130" height="86" alt="CM Rawat meets Sonia, ducks question on holding early polls" align="left" title="CM Rawat meets Sonia, ducks question on holding early polls" border="0" /></a>A day after being reinstated as the Chief Minister of Uttarakhand, Harish Rawat Thursday arrived in Delhi along with his council of ministers and met Congress president Sonia Gandhi. Rawat also said that as chief minister he was always willing to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Finance Minister Arun Jaitley for the development of the state. Asked about the possibility of a Cabinet reshuffle or snap polls in the state, Rawat said: “That will happen when the time comes.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Uttarakhand crisis: Shiv Sena editorial says BJP must understand importance of democracy</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/uttarakhand-crisis-shiv-sena-editorial-024700074.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/OLAlDHipvG76tEwOiLaP.A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/e57f08c8cfba09961695d5d8070775f3" width="130" height="86" alt="Uttarakhand crisis: Shiv Sena editorial says BJP must understand importance of democracy" align="left" title="Uttarakhand crisis: Shiv Sena editorial says BJP must understand importance of democracy" border="0" /></a>The Shiv Sena, through its mouthpiece Saamana, once again hit out at the BJP for the way it has handled the Uttarakhand crisis, stating that the party should understand the importance of democracy. Understand the importance of democracy and act accordingly,” an editorial in party mouthpiece Saamana said. The political offensive came at a time when a row has surfaced over the raising of the height of the Medigadda barrage in Gadchiroli, which impacts citizens from both states. Maharashtra Congress leader Sachin Sawant alleged Thursday that the Governor had been pushing the project despite strong protests from locals in Gadchiroli.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/governor-c-h-vidyasagar-rao-024000454.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 08:10:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">governor-c-h-vidyasagar-rao-024000454</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/doye3PIIGFvJOsf3P0v2Gw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b9958b3783db9441858844caaf90d255" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/governor-c-h-vidyasagar-rao-024000454.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/doye3PIIGFvJOsf3P0v2Gw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/b9958b3783db9441858844caaf90d255" width="130" height="86" alt="Governor C H Vidyasagar Rao overlooking Maharashtra’s interest: Congress" align="left" title="Governor C H Vidyasagar Rao overlooking Maharashtra’s interest: Congress" border="0" /></a>THE Congress on Thursday launched a scathing attack against Maharashtra Governor CH Vidyasagar Rao alleging he was “overlooking the interest of Maharashtra while promoting his native state Telangana’s interest”. On both the issues of exchange rate and interest rate, it is still on,” he said. The negotiations are also being undertaken by the Indian oil refiners with the Iranian firms on the payment route details including selection of bank and the countries through which India will route src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/UoTIZzzaHgTWjz5jS.xFuw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/24ca9804a7174364dfc6661c29be7d61" width="130" height="86" alt="Why Janu, Kerala’s tribal face, isn’t talking ‘land’ in Wayanad" align="left" title="Why Janu, Kerala’s tribal face, isn’t talking ‘land’ in Wayanad" border="0" /></a>“I am not making any new promises,” says C K Janu, 46, the face of some of the biggest tribal agitations in Kerala in recent years. Janu was born to a family of Adiyas, an extremely backward tribal group whose members once worked as bonded labourers. The literacy drive in Kerala of the 1980s transformed the unlettered young woman into a leader.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/why-janu-kerala-tribal-face-015000324.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:20:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">why-janu-kerala-tribal-face-015000324</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/UoTIZzzaHgTWjz5jS.xFuw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/24ca9804a7174364dfc6661c29be7d61" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/why-janu-kerala-tribal-face-015000324.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/UoTIZzzaHgTWjz5jS.xFuw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/24ca9804a7174364dfc6661c29be7d61" width="130" height="86" alt="Why Janu, Kerala’s tribal face, isn’t talking ‘land’ in Wayanad" align="left" title="Why Janu, Kerala’s tribal face, isn’t talking ‘land’ in Wayanad" border="0" /></a>“I am not making any new promises,” says C K Janu, 46, the face of some of the biggest tribal agitations in Kerala in recent years. Janu was born to a family of Adiyas, an extremely backward tribal group whose members once worked as bonded labourers. The literacy drive in Kerala of the 1980s transformed the unlettered young woman into a leader.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Chandy wants PM to retract ‘Somalia’ remark, says may move EC</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandy-wants-pm-retract-somalia-014400168.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/KkhCzgpCKKh896Zet7uy0g--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/f08c542b873b3cb2d820bc373866596f" width="130" height="86" alt="Chandy wants PM to retract ‘Somalia’ remark, says may move EC" align="left" title="Chandy wants PM to retract ‘Somalia’ remark, says may move EC" border="0" /></a>THE CONTROVERSY over the Prime Minister’s remarks likening Kerala to Somalia refused to die down on Thursday, with Chief Minister Oommen Chandy stating that the state government was mulling moving the Election Commission and taking legal action against Modi. The opposition CPM also flayed the Prime Minister for not withdrawing his comment. This is an insult to the people of Kerala.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandy-wants-pm-retract-somalia-014400168.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:14:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">chandy-wants-pm-retract-somalia-014400168</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/KkhCzgpCKKh896Zet7uy0g--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/f08c542b873b3cb2d820bc373866596f" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/chandy-wants-pm-retract-somalia-014400168.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/KkhCzgpCKKh896Zet7uy0g--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/f08c542b873b3cb2d820bc373866596f" width="130" height="86" alt="Chandy wants PM to retract ‘Somalia’ remark, says may move EC" align="left" title="Chandy wants PM to retract ‘Somalia’ remark, says may move EC" border="0" /></a>THE CONTROVERSY over the Prime Minister’s remarks likening Kerala to Somalia refused to die down on Thursday, with Chief Minister Oommen Chandy stating that the state government was mulling moving the Election Commission and taking legal action against Modi. The opposition CPM also flayed the Prime Minister for not withdrawing his comment. This is an insult to the people of Kerala.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Bombay HC defers Nilesh Rane’s bail plea to May 17</title><description>The Bombay High Court Thursday deferred hearing on the anticipatory bail petition filed by former Congress MP Nilesh Rane, son of former Maharashtra chief minister Narayan Rane, to May 17.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/bombay-hc-defers-nilesh-rane-014000687.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:10:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">bombay-hc-defers-nilesh-rane-014000687</guid></item><item><title>US federal judge rules in favour of Republicans against 'Obamacare'</title><description>Washington, May 13 (IANS/EFE) A federal judge on Thursday ruled in favour of Republican lawmakers in their lawsuit against the health care reform known as "Obamacare", saying that the US government is unconstitutionally using public funds to make access to health services less costly. Judge Rosemary Collyer, who was appointed to the bench by Republican president George W. Bush, said the federal government has no authority to spend public funds without the specific approval of Congress. The decision will remain on hold, however, and Obamacare will remain in place since the government will file an appeal.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/us-federal-judge-rules-favour-republicans-against-obamacare-013603106.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:06:03 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.ians.in/">IANS India Private Limited</source><guid isPermaLink="false">us-federal-judge-rules-favour-republicans-against-obamacare-013603106</guid></item><item><title>Battling ahead, a ‘general’ in waiting in Tamil Nadu</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/battling-ahead-general-waiting-tamil-013600505.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/AywWqT0DVUSv4Ni4zGZGFQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/df54b6fbd52041fb141aa599082e666c" width="130" height="86" alt="Battling ahead, a ‘general’ in waiting in Tamil Nadu" align="left" title="Battling ahead, a ‘general’ in waiting in Tamil Nadu" border="0" /></a>For nine months now, the DMK heir-apparent has been on a state-wide tour, criss-crossing its 234 constituencies. Strategically placed members of his brand team take photographs from terraces around, as at least four floodlights focus on Stalin. The man himself stands at the middle of a square surrounded by banners and cutouts of him and father M Karunanidhi, with any other DMK signs virtually absent.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/battling-ahead-general-waiting-tamil-013600505.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:06:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">battling-ahead-general-waiting-tamil-013600505</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/AywWqT0DVUSv4Ni4zGZGFQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/df54b6fbd52041fb141aa599082e666c" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/battling-ahead-general-waiting-tamil-013600505.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/AywWqT0DVUSv4Ni4zGZGFQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/df54b6fbd52041fb141aa599082e666c" width="130" height="86" alt="Battling ahead, a ‘general’ in waiting in Tamil Nadu" align="left" title="Battling ahead, a ‘general’ in waiting in Tamil Nadu" border="0" /></a>For nine months now, the DMK heir-apparent has been on a state-wide tour, criss-crossing its 234 constituencies. Strategically placed members of his brand team take photographs from terraces around, as at least four floodlights focus on Stalin. The man himself stands at the middle of a square surrounded by banners and cutouts of him and father M Karunanidhi, with any other DMK signs virtually absent.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Republicans score court victory against Obamacare</title><description>Republicans clinched a victory Thursday against President Barack Obama's signature health care law, when a federal judge ruled that two of its central provisions violate the US Constitution. US District Judge Rosemary Collyer in Washington agreed with the Republican-led House of Representatives, which said the law illegally uses public funds to pay for tax credits to make insurance premiums more affordable, or to reduce deductibles, co-pays and other insurer "cost-sharing" measures for lower-income individuals. Collyer said Health and Human Services Secretary Sylvia Burwell and the White House Office of Management and Budget wrongfully spent the money without Congress first appropriating it.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/republicans-score-court-victory-against-013547730.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:05:47 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">republicans-score-court-victory-against-013547730</guid></item><item><title>House OKs bipartisan drug abuse bills, but Dems want money</title><description>WASHINGTON (AP) — The House has approved a mountain of bills addressing the nation's opioid abuse crisis, fueled by lawmakers' bipartisan craving for election-year action on the deadly epidemic. Yet the measures are leaving anti-drug advocates underwhelmed, and Congress won't decide till later how much money it's willing to provide.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/house-oking-bipartisan-drug-abuse-bills-dems-want-190917291.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:00:02 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">house-oking-bipartisan-drug-abuse-bills-dems-want-190917291</guid></item><item><title>BJP, SP turning universities into political wrestling grounds: Mayawati</title><description><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/bjp-sp-turning-universities-political-003500747.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/aSSqQY7zdHpsT5UHVDbNLA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/886bf2526d03b2a17f585bf71d260894" width="130" height="86" alt="BJP, SP turning universities into political wrestling grounds: Mayawati" align="left" title="BJP, SP turning universities into political wrestling grounds: Mayawati" border="0" /></a>ALLEGING “undue interference” from the Centre in functioning of universities, BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said both BJP and ruling Samajwadi Party are trying to disturb and communalise the atmosphere of higher education institutes with an eye on the upcoming Assembly elections. Citing the example of Allahabad University, where Vice-Chancellor R L Hangloo has threatened to resign due to alleged political interference on the issue of admission procedure by BJP MPs, the former CM said the BJP government is trying to disturb the atmosphere of campuses in order to impose the “divisive, hateful and casteist” agenda of the RSS. In a statement, Mayawati said the interference of the central government into universities has increased in the past two years and it has led to “politicisation” of campuses, which have turned into into “wrestling grounds” for political parties.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/bjp-sp-turning-universities-political-003500747.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:05:00 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://indianexpress.com/">The Indian Express</source><guid isPermaLink="false">bjp-sp-turning-universities-political-003500747</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/aSSqQY7zdHpsT5UHVDbNLA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/886bf2526d03b2a17f585bf71d260894" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://in.news.yahoo.com/bjp-sp-turning-universities-political-003500747.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/aSSqQY7zdHpsT5UHVDbNLA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en-IN/homerun/articles.indianexpress.com/886bf2526d03b2a17f585bf71d260894" width="130" height="86" alt="BJP, SP turning universities into political wrestling grounds: Mayawati" align="left" title="BJP, SP turning universities into political wrestling grounds: Mayawati" border="0" /></a>ALLEGING “undue interference” from the Centre in functioning of universities, BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said both BJP and ruling Samajwadi Party are trying to disturb and communalise the atmosphere of higher education institutes with an eye on the upcoming Assembly elections. Citing the example of Allahabad University, where Vice-Chancellor R L Hangloo has threatened to resign due to alleged political interference on the issue of admission procedure by BJP MPs, the former CM said the BJP government is trying to disturb the atmosphere of campuses in order to impose the “divisive, hateful and casteist” agenda of the RSS. In a statement, Mayawati said the interference of the central government into universities has increased in the past two years and it has led to “politicisation” of campuses, which have turned into into “wrestling grounds” for political parties.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Brazil's feminists fear setbacks as first woman president suspended</title><description>By Caroline Stauffer SAO PAULO (Reuters) - Hours after Dilma Rousseff, Brazil's first woman president, was suspended by a Senate vote to put her on trial for breaking budget laws, the man who took her place unveiled his cabinet: an all-male line-up of 23 ministers. The significance was not lost on feminists in the Latin American country, especially after a male-dominated Congress voted to remove Rousseff amid shouts of "Goodbye, dear!" "Fifty-two percent of Brazil's population has been ignored," said Rachel Moreno, coordinator of a group that seeks to combat violence against women. "We have suffered an attack from conservatives on the achievements of the feminist movement," she said in a telephone interview from a women's rights conference in Brasilia that Rousseff attended this week.</description><link>https://in.news.yahoo.com/brazils-feminists-fear-setbacks-first-woman-president-suspended-003345191.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:03:45 +0530</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">brazils-feminists-fear-setbacks-first-woman-president-suspended-003345191</guid></item></channel>
